Arr::accessible.description: The Arr::accessible method checks that the given value is array accessible.

Arr::add.description: The Arr::add method adds a given key / value pair to an array if the given key doesn't already exist in the array or is set to null.

Arr::collapse.description: The Arr::collapse method collapses an array of arrays into a single array.

Arr::crossJoin.description: The Arr::crossJoin method cross joins the given arrays, returning a Cartesian product with all possible permutations.

Arr::divide.description: The Arr::divide method returns two arrays, one containing the keys, and the other containing the values of the given array.

Arr::dot.description: The Arr::dot method flattens a multi-dimensional array into a single level array that uses "dot" notation to indicate depth.

Arr::except.description: The Arr::except method removes the given key / value pairs from an array.

Arr::exists.description: The Arr::exists method checks that the given key exists in the provided array.

Arr::first.description: The Arr::first method returns the first element of an array passing a given truth test.

Arr::flatten.description: The Arr::flatten method flattens a multi-dimensional array into a single level array.

Arr::forget.description: The Arr::forget method removes a given key / value pair from a deeply nested array using "dot" notation.

Arr::get.description: The Arr::get method retrieves a value from a deeply nested array using "dot" notation.

Arr::has.description: The Arr::has method checks whether a given item or items exists in an array using "dot" notation.

Arr::hasAny.description: The Arr::hasAny method checks whether any item in a given set exists in an array using "dot" notation.

Arr::isAssoc returns true.description: The Arr::isAssoc returns true if the given array is an associative array. An array is considered "associative" if it doesn't have sequential numerical keys beginning with zero.

Arr::last.description: The Arr::last method returns the last element of an array passing a given truth test.

Arr::only.description: The Arr::only method returns only the specified key / value pairs from the given array.

Arr::pluck.description: The Arr::pluck method retrieves all of the values for a given key from an array.

Arr::prepend.description: The Arr::prepend method will push an item onto the beginning of an array.

Arr::pull.description: The Arr::pull method returns and removes a key / value pair from an array.

Arr::query.description: The Arr::query method converts the array into a query string.

Arr::random.description: The Arr::random method returns a random value from an array.

Arr::set.description: The Arr::set method sets a value within a deeply nested array using "dot" notation.

Arr::shuffle.description: The Arr::shuffle method randomly shuffles the items in the array.

Arr::sort.description: The Arr::sort method sorts an array by its values.

Arr::sortRecursive.description: The Arr::sortRecursive method recursively sorts an array using the sort function for numeric sub=arrays and ksort for associative subarrays.

Arr::where.description: The Arr::where method filters an array using the given Closure.

Arr::wrap.description: The Arr::wrap method wraps the given value in an array. If the given value is already an array it will not be changed.
